description: {"blocks":[{"key":"5cr9g","text":"Protocol used for cloning mouseome into T7 genome for PhIP-seq","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
document:
{"blocks":[{"key":"2mit4","text":"Protocol used for Mousome PhIP-seq in the Rackaityte et. al study ","type":"align-center","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":66},{"style":"italic","offset":42,"length":17},{"style":"italic","offset":60,"length":6}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ch7uv","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bnddt","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"74kic","text":"Part 1 - Phage Library Preparation ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":35}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8lvg0","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"csr7t","text":"(Adapted from Aug 2018 protocol by Jay Rajan, Derisi Lab)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":57}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"asd9u","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"co366","text":"Complex oligonucleotide library packaging in bacteriophage T7","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":61},{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":0,"length":61}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"aumjo","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dcg2p","text":"This protocol describes starting from the oligo pool of the library to packaging it in T7 phage. 

Step 1: Oligonucleotide pool amplification (Day 1)

Reagents
2x Agilent oligonucleotide pools; resuspended at 0.2 nM
Phusion polymerase
5X Phusion reaction buffer
Nuclease free H20","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":97},{"style":"bold","offset":99,"length":50},{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":151,"length":8},{"style":"sub","offset":277,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"93o07","text":"10mM dNTP
","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cr0e5","text":"Primers
10 uM Forward cloning primer (10bp of flanking sequence+EcoR I site +T+ 5' linker ); aim for Tmof 65 C
10 uM Reverse cloning primer (10bp of flanking sequence+Hind III site+ reverse complement of 3'linker )
","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":0,"length":7},{"style":"sub","offset":102,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"kj81","text":"       ATCCTGAGCTAAGCTTGAGGCCATGGCATATGCTTA                                          ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":85}],"data":{}},{"key":"5effs","text":"
1.Set up PCR reactions in either 50ul volume. Given expected nucleic acid loss after bead purification, in general would shoot for at least 4 x 50ul reactions per oligo pool.
2.PCR reaction conditions (50 ul reaction; scale quantities appropriately for volume)

5X Phusion buffer-10ul
10uM Fwd Cloning Primer-1ul
10uM Rev Cloning Primer-1ul
10mM dNTP-1ul
Phusion-1ul
0.2nM Oligonucleotide pool-0.5ul
H2O-35.5ul","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":402,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7ko4u","text":"
PCR program
98 x 30s

For 20 cycles:

98 x 5s
70 x 20s
72 x 15s

72 x 2 minutes
10 x infinity

3.While the PCR is running, warm Ampure XP beads to room temperature
4.Clean up the PCR with 1 volume room temperature Ampure XP beads using the standard protocol. After the second 70% ethanol wash, do a quick spin of the beads in a microcentrifuge (30s, at least 8000g) to ‘pellet’ any residual alcohol. Place back on magnet and remove the small amount of remaining alcohol.
5.Allow beads to dry for 5 minutes, remove from magnet
6.Resuspend beads in 40ul nuclease-free H2O, incubate at room temperature for 2 minutes
7.Place back on magnet for 1 minute, remove supernatant
5.Quantify DNA by Qubit
6.Run 5 ul of the sample on a 1-2% agarose gel to confirm that only a single band of the expected size is present before going on to the restriction digest.

Step 2: Restriction digestion and insert purification (Day 1)

1.Set up a 50ul restriction digest using the template DNA prepared in Step 1:

TemplateX ul (1 ug)
NEB 10X Cut-Smart buffer-5ul
NEB EcoR I – HF - 1ul
NEB Hind III – HF - 1ul
H2050ul – X ul

2.Incubate in the thermal cycler, without lid heating, at 37 C for 1 hour
3.Heat inactivate at 65 C for 10 minutes, then place on ice or store at 4 C
4.Purify the restriction digest using 1 volume of Ampure XP beads, as described above in step 1.
5.Use the Bioanalyzer to confirm the expected 20 bp shift between cut and uncut insert.
6.Set up a 5ml overnight culture of E coli strain BLT-5403, can pick a colony from a plate streaked from the glycerol stock, or inoculate directly from glycerol stock (scrape pipet tip, and pipet up and down into 5ml of LB-Carb in an overnight culture tube).

IMPORTANT: AT NO POINT SHOULD THE AMPLIFIED TEMPLATE DNA BE EXPOSED TO UV (E.G. FROM THE GELDOC). THIS DRAMATICALLY REDUCES CLONING EFFICIENCY AND CAN INTRODUCE BIAS INTO THE LIBRARY.


Step 3: Cloning into T7 backbone (Day 2)

1.Set up the ligation reaction using NEB QuickLigase or T4 DNA ligase. For a single Agilent oligonucleotide pool (238,068 oligos), did 4 packaging reactions. The more packaged phage one has to start with, the better the library will be in terms of representation. Aiming for >= 108(~500X overage)phage for a single pool ensures excellent library representation. Setting up the ligations as individual reactions (4 x 5ul reactions vs 1 x 20ul reaction) works well for the cloning.
","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":1,"length":11},{"style":"sub","offset":568,"length":1},{"style":"sub","offset":1091,"length":1},{"style":"bold","offset":853,"length":61},{"style":"bold","offset":1887,"length":40},{"style":"sup","offset":2209,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cv21v","text":"
T4 ligase buffer (10x):0.5 ul
T7 vector arms (.02 pmol):1 ul
Insert (0.06 pmol):x ul
T4 ligase:1 ul
H2O:2.5 ul – x ul","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5oi9c","text":"-----------","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ccng9","text":"Total - 5ul ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5crt6","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5b6ue","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cujvj","text":"2.Incubate at 16 C overnight (~12H) in the thermal cycler without lid heating and heat inactivate at 65 C x 10 minutes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b1ukp","text":"3.Place the ligation reaction on ice immediately or store at 4 C until use","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7kji6","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"146jv","text":"Step 4: Packaging (Day 2)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":25}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1m5g8","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1qmu7","text":"Four packaging reactions as below were performed in 30ul volumes each.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bqrmf","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f1dlf","text":"1.Pipet 5 ul of ligation into a clean Eppendorf tube. Add 25 ul of packaging extract to the 5 ul, stirring the mixture with the pipet tip 10-20 times.Do not pipet up and down. Repeat the same procedure for the number of packaging reactions that are being done.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":150,"length":24}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"685ta","text":"2.Incubate at room temperature for 2 hours (on bench top)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8qgc4","text":"3.Quench the packaging reaction with 270 ul of cold LB-Carb medium and place on ice.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7cmr","text":"4. Titer the packaging reaction with a plaque assay ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3n4hj","text":"5.Calculate the number of E. coli cells needed to inoculate phage at an MOI of 0.001. For example, if the titer of the packaging reaction is 1x108pfu/ml, would need 1 x 1011E coli. At an OD600of 0.5, there are 2 x 108E coli/ml. So 500 ml of OD600E coli equals 1 x 1011cells.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":145,"length":1},{"style":"sup","offset":171,"length":2},{"style":"sup","offset":216,"length":1},{"style":"sup","offset":266,"length":2},{"style":"sub","offset":189,"length":3},{"style":"sub","offset":243,"length":3}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2unkr","text":"6.Use the remainder of the overnight culture from Step 2 to inoculate the volume of E coli required for library amplification and grow to an OD600of 0.5 in the 37 C shaking incubator. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":143,"length":3}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fn7g2","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4h5ot","text":"Step 5: Liquid lysate amplification (Day 2)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":43}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"508a1","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2e44t","text":"1.Inoculate the OD6000.5 E coli cultures with the combined packaging reactions.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":18,"length":3}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c5tsb","text":"2.Incubate the inoculated cultures in the 37 C shaking incubator and monitor for lysis. Typically, lysis occurs ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"jqiq","text":"1-1.5H post-inoculation, though it can sometimes take longer. Do not let the lysis go any longer than necessary.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7feid","text":"3.Add 0.1 volumes of 5M NaCl to stabilize the phage lysate (e.g. 50ml of 5M NaCl to 500 ml of lysate)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6usih","text":"4.Clarify the stabilized lysate by centrifuging in 500ml polycarbonate Oakridge tubes at 15,000g x 30 minutes at 4 C. Filter the clarified lysate into aglass wide-mouth bottle(make sure the o-ring is intact) using 0.2 uM bottle-top filter units. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":152,"length":23}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3ou85","text":"5.Add 5X PEG-NaCl solution to the filtered, clarified lysate to a final concentration of 1X (e.g. add 140 ml of 5X PEG-NaCl to 550 ml of stabilized lysate and 10ml of LB to bring to a total volume of 700ml). Store the bottle at 4C in the cold room overnight, with or without agitation.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"acun8","text":"6.The PEG solution will be turbid the next day. Divide the PEG-containing solution across 500 ml Oakridge polycarbonate tubes and spin at 15,000g x 1H to ensure that all of the PEG precipitate pellets on the side of the centrifuge tube.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4jvoj","text":"7.Carefully decant the supernatant, taking care to not disturb the pellet. Resuspend the pellet in a volume of SM buffer equivalent to the original culture volume (e.g. 500ml of SM if the original culture volume was 500ml) and place in a fresh wide-mouth glass bottle (again, with o-ring intact). Reducing the volume (e.g. by half) will result in a more concentrated prep.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ag9ds","text":"8.Add an autoclaved magnetic stir-bar and stir overnight at 4 C at the minimum speed required to circulate the entire volume.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bs28k","text":"9.The resuspended PEG precipitate will be slightly turbid the next day, but there should be no large particles. Filter the solution into a wide-mouth glass bottle using bottle-top 0.2 uM filters. As before, 1 bottle-top filter is good for about 200ml of solution.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2a5ob","text":"10.Store the filtrate in glass bottle at 4C. Freeze down stocks of the library by adding 0.1 volumes of autoclaved 80% glycerol. Lysate stocks should be stored at -80C.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5pjdf","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9lgav","text":"Step 6 : Sequence Alignment (Day 3-4)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":37}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5ck14","text":"Pick 10-20 plaques from phage titer plates into 50uL of PCR-grade water. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"foub7","text":"Bake phage plaque to prep for PCR at 70°C for 15 mins ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":37,"length":17}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"qaub","text":"Send for Sanger sequencing using primers outside of the insert site to confirm that the insert is in-frame and correctly oriented","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ll15","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cbu3v","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"au5bq","text":"              SF2   ACGGTGGTCTTCGCCCAG      Forward universal T7 primer for   amplifying cloned insert for Sanger Sequencing      SR2   CATATAGTTCCTCCTTTCAGCA      Reverse universal T7 primer for amplifying cloned insert for   Sanger Sequencing     ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":249}],"data":{}},{"key":"dth82","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5b6e0","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7g14m","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9rauv","text":"Step 7: Phage Library sequencing (Day 3-4)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":42}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"clicc","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"aster","text":"Paired-end 150 bp can be done to cover the entire peptide sequence in the read. blocking buffer (3% BSA fraction V in 1X TBS-Tween) added to each well in a 2ml deep-well 96 well plate.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4qa6f","text":"Cover with foil seal and set for rotating overnight in the overhead in the cold room.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e6g56","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e6rmn","text":"Day 1 - Set up IP round 1:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":26}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"92lvd","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4h7l","text":"Pipette out the blocking buffer. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2m06u","text":"Add 500uL of stock Phage-Library (1010 pfu/ml) to each well. Allow 10’ to mix thoroughly overhead at 4 degrees. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":36,"length":2}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"daici","text":"Add appropriate amount of human sample or commercial antibody. If mouse plasma, stock the sample in 1:1 storage buffer (0.04% NaN3, 40% Glycerol, 40mM HEPES to preserve antibody integrity). Then, make required dilution of that stock in 1x PBS and use 1ul in the IP. 1ul of 1:1 dilution of plasma was used in the study. For GFAP samples, 1ug of GFAP was added.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b2bq0","text":"Set for rotating overnight in the overhead in the cold room.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9118o","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ffuo0","text":"Day 2 - Round 1 IP ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":19}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"efibj","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a7q74","text":"Grow up E.Coli (BLT 5403) and make sure you have a non-contaminated stock before moving forward with IP’ing with A/G beads. ","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"co3u1","text":"Wash protein A/G beads (Dynabeads, Thermo Fisher Cat No 10002D and 10004D, respectively) with Tris/NP-40, 3 x 3’ minutes at 4 degrees overhead. Use 25ul of A Slurry and 25 uL of G slurry per IP - mix and wash them in TNP-40. After three washes, resuspend the beads in a final volume of 25ul Tris/NP-40. ","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"h5v6","text":"Add 25 ul of the washed A/G bead mixture into each well. ","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cg41c","text":"Immunoprecipitate with beads for 1 hour, overhead at 4 degrees. Do not prolong this step.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":64,"length":25}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ah774","text":"Using a magnetic rack, wash the IP 5x for 10’ minutes each, overhead at 4 degrees with 500ul cold RIPA buffer to each well","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"60hpp","text":"During one of the washes, remove the E. coli (OD between 0.4-0.7). Aliquot 1mL into each well in a new 96-well deep well plate. ","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":36,"length":8}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"70lhj","text":"After the 5th RIPA wash, resuspend beads in 125 ul LB/CARB","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4lb8n","text":"Add the total volume of resuspended beads  to the deep well plate with 1 mL of E. Coli in LB/CARB OD600= 0.5. Incubate 37C with orbital shaking, sealed with a gas permeable seal. Solution should clarify within an hour and half to two hours.  ","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2sg69","text":"After the ecoli has clarified- remove from 37, place on bench. Add 5.0 M NaCl for a final molarity of 0.5 NaCl ","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dktad","text":"Spin 3000xg 1h 4C and take 500ul lysate to repeat another round of IP. ","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dts69","text":"Save 100ul of lysate for sequencing. ","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dibnu","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6dgln","text":"Set up Round 2 IP with 500ul lysate from Round 1 and repeat the next day. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"60adp","text":"Set up Round 3 IP with 500ul lysate from Round 2 and repeat the next day.
